issue.title: swagger flatten assumes incorrect base-path
issue.body:
## Problem statement

assume I have a collection of lots of nested spec files like so: (totally fictitious)
- api/petStore.yaml
- models/pet.yaml
- models/error.yaml

where `api/petStore.yaml` includes `$ref: models/error.yaml#/error`

then run:
`swagger flatten ./api/petStore.yaml`

the flatten command assumes a basePath of `./api`, which in this case is incorrect and makes all the references not resolve correctly

error:
`open /Users/pwmcintyre/git/example/api/models/error.yaml: no such file or directory`

offending line:
https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/2f32a5a852851b98aa1ed3d0d3d2aab4dcf27c6b/cmd/swagger/commands/flatten.go#L41

I'm wondering if we can make this value parameterized -- example:
`swagger --basePath . flatten ./api/petStore.yaml`

... or if there are other workarounds?

## Environment
swagger version: v0.19.0
go version: go1.12.7 darwin/amd64
OS: macos

body:
First take at this, trying to pinpoint the problem: I've reproduced the issue with your testcase and it looks to me the problem is actually in the `go-openapi/spec`  expander, rather than in the spec flattening: `swagger expand` and ` swagger validate` commands experience the same issue you've pointed out.
On the other hand doing ` swagger flatten schemas/api/api.yaml` just works.

thanks for your hard work on this!

FYI -- I've just re-run my flatten after bumping the spec package and it works fine now

ie.
```
git clone https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger && cd go-swagger
go get -u github.com/go-openapi/spec@master
go install ./cmd/swagger
```
Ok will merge this in go swagger

issue.title: use $ref under path cause one route not found error
issue.body:
## Problem statement
curl http://127.0.0.1:65475/v1/test
{"code":404,"message":"path /v1/test was not found"}

## Swagger specification
```
swagger: "2.0"
info:
  description: Test
  title: Test
  version: "0.0.1"
basePath: /v1
consumes:
  - application/json
produces:
  - application/json

paths:
  /test/a:
    $ref: "#/paths/~1test"
  /test:
    get:
      operationId: test
      responses:
        200:
          description: OK
```
## Steps to reproduce
1 . swagger generate code
2. curl http://127.0.0.1:65475/v1/test/a, response  ok
3. curl http://127.0.0.1:65475/v1/test, got a 404 error

## Environment
swagger version: v0.21.0
go version: go1.13.1
OS:   darwin/amd64

issue.title: Ref in paths / responses / parameters:  flatten $ref in Paths (covers skip schemas)
issue.body:
* Contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#2113 

This covers the case of $ref's under Path, with some schemas inside. Previous PR #110 did not rebase correctly non-expanded $refs when flatten skips schema expansion.

NOTE: had to add some quick patches to keep things working on windows, although we know that windows support for $ref is still patchy at the moment (see issue #97)

issue.title: Split files generates inconsistency across commands
issue.body:
## Problem statement
I'm testing the split of a single `swagger.yml` into smaller chunks but I'm getting a not consistent behaviour between validate and generate commands.

No errors found when the validate command is run. Instead, when I execute the generate command I get the following error:
`could not resolve schema: open /go/src/github.com/codebien/definitions.yml: no such file or directory`
The generate command is researching the file into the wrong path.
The expected path is: `/go/src/github.com/codebien/swag/swagger/definitions.yml`

I have created a [repo](https://github.com/codebien/swag) to share the code.

## Swagger specification
This is the main swagger file
```
swagger: '2.0'
info:
  version: 0.0.0
  title: Simple API
paths:
  /foo:
    $ref: 'swagger/paths/foo.yml'
  /bar:
    $ref: 'swagger/paths/bar.yml'
  /nested:
    $ref: 'swagger/paths/nested.yml#/response'
```

## Steps to reproduce
* Download the project
* Execute the validate command
* Execute the generate command

## Environment
swagger version: 0.23.0
go version: docker 0.23.0 (Go 1.14)
